panels.description:
Shows the time from the Boundary Node receiving a request until the response is being returned to the client. This just shows if queues are building in the Boundary Nodes as not everything can be processed at once.
* Good conditions: on average around 500ms (some outliers)
* Bad conditions: on average >750ms
panels.title: (Boundary Nodes) Host Latencies

alert.message: Boundary Nodes are returning an excess of 5XX responses
alert.name: BoundaryNodeStatusCode5XX

panels.description:
Shows the HTTP status codes of all requests being answered by the boundary nodes. If anything is going wrong with the Boundary Nodes, we should see it here.
* Good conditions: 2XX status codes (e.g., mostly 200s and some 204s)
* Bad conditions: 5XX

Status Code Explanation: 
Codes 200-299 are for successful responses. 300-399 are for redirections. 400-499 are for client errors (429 is for throttling). 500-599 are for server errors. For more details, see e.g. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Status.
panels.title: (Boundary Nodes) Status Codes

panels.description: Mean node CPU mode (all processes), across all instances.
panels.title: (Hardware) Node CPU Mode

panels.description: Mean RX/TX packets and bytes, across nodes.
panels.title: (Hardware) Node Network Traffic

panels.description:
Median replica resident memory, broken out by use / component.

Mostly makes sense only when looking at single subnets.
panels.title: (Hardware) Resident Memory

targets.expr:
label_replace(
  sum by(status_, request_type, type) (
    label_replace(
      rate(replica_http_request_duration_seconds_count{job="replica",ic="$ic",ic_subnet=~"$ic_subnet",instance=~"$instance", request_type="call"}[$period]),
      "status_", "$1", "status", "([0-9]{3}).*"
    )
  ),
  "request_type", "", "request_type", "unknown")

panels.description: Increase of BLS signature verification cache hits over aggregation period. BLS signatures are the major overhead of canister signatures. We expect to see many (very efficient) cache hits and very few (slow) cache misses.
panels.title: (Crypto) BLS cache hits

panels.description: Increase of BLS signature verification cache misses over aggregation period. BLS signatures are the major overhead of canister signatures. We expect to see many (very efficient) cache hits and very few (slow) cache misses.
panels.title: (Crypto) BLS cache misses

targets.expr:
sum (
  quantile by(ic, status, ic_subnet) (
    0.5,
    rate(mr_inducted_ingress_message_count{ic="$ic",ic_subnet=~"$ic_subnet"}[$period])
  )
)
/ on ()
quantile by(ic, ic_subnet) (
  0.5,
  rate(artifact_pool_consensus_height_stat{job="replica",ic="$ic",ic_subnet=~"$ic_subnet",type="finalization",pool_type="validated",stat="max"}[$period])
)

panels.description: Mean difference (over $period) betweenv alidated (green) and unvalidated (blue) finalization and certification max height.
panels.title: (Consensus) Certification Latency

panels.description:
The average number of Wasm instructions executed in an execution round.

Related submetrics:
- subnet queue instructions,
- consensus queue instructions,
- message instructions.
panels.title: (Execution) Round instructions, avg

panels.description:
Replicated messages executed per second, by type.

The left Y axis measures replicated messages (shown above the zero line); the right Y axis measures non-replicated queries (shown below the zero line). Note the different scales, as there are usually way more non-replicated queries than other types of messages.
panels.title: (Execution) Replicated messages

panels.description:
Failed replicated message executions per second, by  subnet and error condition.

The left Y axis measures replicated messages (shown above the zero line); the right Y axis measures non-replicated queries (shown below the zero line). Note the different scales, as there are usually way more non-replicated queries than other types of messages.
panels.title: (Execution) Failed replicated messages

panels.description:
Non-replicated queries executed per second

The left Y axis measures replicated messages (shown above the zero line); the right Y axis measures non-replicated queries (shown below the zero line). Note the different scales, as there are usually way more non-replicated queries than other types of messages.
panels.title: (Execution) Non-replicated queries

panels.description:
Failed query executions per second, by  subnet and error condition.

The left Y axis measures replicated messages (shown above the zero line); the right Y axis measures non-replicated queries (shown below the zero line). Note the different scales, as there are usually way more non-replicated queries than other types of messages.
panels.title: (Execution) Failed non-replicated queries

panels.description:
The average duration of an execution round.

Related submetrics:
- subnet queue duration,
- consensus queue duration,
- message duration.
panels.title: (Execution) Round duration, avg

panels.description: The average number of ingress messages that expired before reaching a terminal state.
panels.title: (Replica) Expired ingress messages

panels.description: The average number of entries kept in the ingress history
panels.title: Ingress messages in history

panels.description: Subnet messages inducted per second by  status, averaged over **$period**.
panels.title: (XNeT) Message Induction Rate
